meanings.definition: To crumple or crush into a loose mass.
meanings.sent1: She scrumpled the paper into a ball and threw it in the trash.
meanings.sent2: The wind scrumpled the fallen leaves into a pile.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally scrumpled his homework while rushing to finish it.
meanings.sent4: The toddler scrumpled the playdough into various shapes.
meanings.sent5: The cat scrumpled the blanket into a cozy nest.

meanings.sent1: The old book pages were scrumpled from years of use.
meanings.sent2: She scrumpled her forehead in confusion.
meanings.sent3: The dog scrumpled the wrapping paper while trying to open the gift.
meanings.sent4: The dry leaves scrumpled underfoot as they walked through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The fabric scrumpled easily, making it hard to keep smooth.

meanings.sent1: She scrumpled her eyes shut to block out the bright light.
meanings.sent2: The child scrumpled the toy in his hand, trying to break it.
meanings.sent3: The chef scrumpled the dough to make it more pliable.
meanings.sent4: The hiker scrumpled the map in frustration after getting lost.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the situation made her scrumple her fists in anxiety.
